added: Each state and the District of Columbia produces two documents to be forwarded to Congress, a [[certificate of ascertainment]] and a certificate of vote.   A ''certificate of ascertainment'' is an official document that identifies the state's appointed [[United States Electoral College|College electors]] and the tally of the final popular vote count for each candidate in that state.<ref name="wtsp-robinson">{{cite web |last1=Robinson |first1=Courtney |title=It's official: Florida certifies its 2020 election results |url=https://www.wtsp.com/article/news/politics/elections/its-official-florida-certifies-2020-election-results/67-7ea56e93-1d68-400a-b988-5ebe5f456028 |publisher=[[WTSP]] |accessdate=20 November 2020 |date=17 November 2020}}</ref> in a [[United States presidential election|presidential election]],<ref name="we-conniff">{{cite web |last1=Conniff |first1=Ruth |title=Wisconsin's divisive presidential recount begins |url=https://wisconsinexaminer.com/2020/11/19/wisconsins-divisive-presidential-recount-begins/ |publisher=[[Wisconsin Examiner]] |accessdate=20 November 2020 |date=19 November 2020}}</ref><ref name="nyt-astor">{{cite web |last1=Astor |first1=Maggie |title=Here's What Will Happen Between Election Day and Inauguration Day |url=https://www.nytimes.com/article/biden-election-inauguration.html |work=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=19 November 2020 |date=12 November 2020}}</ref> submitted after an election by the [[governor (United States)|governor of each state]] to the [[Archivist of the United States]]<ref name="dj-bedillion">{{cite web |last1=Bedillion |first1=Caleb |title=Final vote tally shows Lee County turnout increase |url=https://www.djournal.com/news/local/final-vote-tally-shows-lee-county-turnout-increase/article_75ba20de-817d-560e-b1cd-e57da647da1c.html |publisher=[[Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal]] |accessdate=20 November 2020 |date=16 November 2020}}</ref><ref name="snopes-lee">{{cite web |title=Could Trump Defy Popular Vote By Halting Voter Certification? |last1=Lee |first1=Jessica |url=https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/could-trump-defy-popular-vote/ |website=[[Snopes]] |accessdate=20 November 2020 |date=19 November 2020}}</ref> and others,<ref name="whyy-albiges">{{cite web |last1=Albiges |first1=Marie |title=Meet Pennsylvania's Electoral College voters: Everything they can — and can't — do |url=https://whyy.org/articles/meet-pennsylvanias-electoral-college-voters-everything-they-can-and-cant-do/ |publisher=WHYY |accessdate=19 November 2020 |date=13 November 2020}}</ref> in accordance with [[Title 3 of the United States Code|3{{nbsp}}U.S.C.{{nbsp}}§§{{nbsp}}6–14]]<ref name="abc-dec-8-2020">{{cite web |last1=Karson |first1=Kendall |title=What to know about Tuesday's 'safe harbor' deadline to certify election results |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/tuesdays-safe-harbor-deadline/story?id=74603806 |work=[[ABC News]] |access-date=9 December 2020 |date=8 December 2020}}</ref><ref name="viebeck-santamarina-wp">{{cite web |last1=Viebeck |first1=Elise |last2=Santamariña |first2=Daniela |title=Vote certification deadlines in states facing legal challenges from Trump, GOP |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/elections/2020/11/12/vote-certification-deadlines-ga-mi-wi-nv-az-pa/ |work=[[The Washington Post]] |accessdate=19 November 2020 |date=12 November 2020}}</ref> and the [[Electoral Count Act]].<ref name="politico-montellaro">{{cite web |last1=Montellaro |first1=Zach |title=What you need to know about how the Electoral College works |url=https://www.politico.com/states/new-york/city-hall/story/2020/11/18/what-you-need-to-know-about-how-the-electoral-college-works-1337102 |publisher=[[Politico]] |accessdate=20 November 2020 |date=19 November 2020}}</ref><ref name="crs-IF11641"/> Within the United States' [[electoral system]], the certificates "[represent] a crucial link between the popular vote and votes cast by electors".<ref name="bustle-2016">{{cite web |last1=Friedmann |first1=Sarah |title=The Certificate Of Ascertainment Records Each Vote |url=https://www.bustle.com/articles/191177-what-is-a-certificate-of-ascertainment-it-provides-a-link-between-the-popular-vote-the |publisher=Bustle |accessdate=19 November 2020 |date=3 November 2016}}</ref>  The certificates must bear the [[List of U.S. state, district, and territorial insignia|state seal]] and the governor's signature. Staff from the [[Office of the Federal Register]] ensure that each certificate contains all legally required information.<ref name="nara-presidential-election-pamphlet">{{cite web |title=The 2020 Presidential Election: Provisions of the Constitution and U.S. Code |url=https://www.archives.gov/files/electoral-college/state-officials/presidential-election-brochure.pdf |website=Office of the Federal Register |publisher=[[National Archives and Records Administration]] |accessdate=19 November 2020 |date=July 2020}}</ref>  When each state's appointed electors meet to vote (on the first Monday after the second Wednesday of December),<ref name="nyt-astor"/> they sign and record their vote on a ''certificate of vote'',<ref name="viebeck-santamarina-wp"/><ref name="crs-IF11641">{{cite web |last1=Neale |first1=Thomas H. |title=The Electoral College: A 2020 Presidential Election Timeline |url=https://crsreports.congress.gov/product/pdf/IF/IF11641 |publisher=Congressional Research Service |accessdate=19 November 2020 |date=22 October 2020}}</ref> which are then paired with the certificate of ascertainment, which together are sent to be opened and counted by congress.<ref name="dixon-ecp-1950">{{cite journal |last1=Dixon |first1=R.{{nbsp}}G. |title=Electoral College Procedure |journal=[[The Western Political Quarterly]] |date=June 1950 |volume=3 |issue=2 |pages=214–224 |doi=10.2307/443484 |publisher=University of Utah|jstor=443484 }}</ref>

added: Republican Congressman [[Peter Meijer]] said that several colleagues would have voted to certify the votes, but did not out of fear for the safety of their familiies.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Amash’s Successor Peter Meijer: Trump’s Deceptions Are ‘Rankly Unfit’ – Reason.com|url=https://reason.com/2021/01/08/amash-successor-peter-meijer-trumps-deceptions-are-rankly-unfit/?amp&__twitter_impression=true|access-date=2021-01-10|website=reason.com}}</ref>
